reason.er.util

Class RandomInteger

  • java.lang.Object
    • reason.er.util.RandomInteger

  • public class RandomInteger
extends java.lang.Object
    This class was adapted from an example I found online. Methods that are from the example are labeled "Original". Methods that I wrote are labeled "New".
    Author:
    Original Code : Neil Coffey : https://www.javamex.com/tutorials/random_numbers/numerical_recipes.shtml,
    New Code : Aaron Eberhart

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RandomInteger()
      Original
      RandomInteger(long seed)
      Original

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected int next(int bits)
      Original
      boolean nextBoolean()
      New Generates a random integer in the range [0,2).
      int nextInt(int bound)
      New Returns a positive integer in the range [0,bound)
      long nextLong()
      Original
      boolean weightedBool(int upper, int lower)
      New
      Generates a random integer in the range [0,upper).
      If the integer is greater than or equal to lower return true, false otherwise.
      The odds of true should be approximately: 1 - (lower / upper)
      If lower is greater than or equal to upper, this method will ALWAYS return false.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • nextBoolean

        public boolean nextBoolean()
        New Generates a random integer in the range [0,2). Returns true if 0, false if 1.
        Returns:
        boolean 1:1

      • weightedBool

        public boolean weightedBool(int upper,
                            int lower)
        New
        Generates a random integer in the range [0,upper).
        If the integer is greater than or equal to lower return true, false otherwise.
        The odds of true should be approximately: 1 - (lower / upper)
        If lower is greater than or equal to upper, this method will ALWAYS return false.
        Parameters:
        upper - int
        lower - int
        Returns:
        boolean
